movie_title: How Small Is An Atom? Spoiler: Very Small.
introduction: Atoms are very weird. Wrapping your head around exactly how weird, is close to impossible – how can

vocabulary.definition: deserving or inviting derision or mockery; absurd.
vocabulary.example: The idea that a single atom could be as big as a marble is ridiculous.
The human fist contains trillions and trillions of atoms.

vocabulary.definition: a subatomic particle that combines to form protons and neutrons.
vocabulary.example: Quarks are believed to be the most fundamental components of matter.

vocabulary.definition: a subatomic particle of about the same mass as a proton but without an electric charge.
vocabulary.example: Neutrons, along with protons, form the core of an atom.

vocabulary.definition: a region in an atom where there is a high probability of finding electrons.
vocabulary.example: Electrons can be found in orbitals around the atom core.

vocabulary.definition: relating to or denoting a discrete quantity of energy proportional in magnitude to the frequency of the radiation it represents.
vocabulary.example: Quantum fluctuations have a fundamental impact on how particles interact.
